prompt: <description>**Part 1: A long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.375, 0.2625]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Draw the following lines to create a rectangle: - Line 1: Starting point (0.0, 0.0), End point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting point (0.75, 0.0), End point (0.75, 0.075) - Line 3: Starting point (0.75, 0.075), End point (0.0, 0.075) - Line 4: Starting point (0.0, 0.075), End point (0.0, 0.0) Close the loop. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0375 units to generate the 3D model. **Part 2: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with an euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.3]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Draw the following lines to create the first rectangle: - Line 1: Starting point (0.0, 0.0), End point (0.0375, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting point (0.0375, 0.0), End point (0.0375, 0.375) - Line 3: Starting point (0.0375, 0.375), End point (0.0, 0.375) - Line 4: Starting point (0.0, 0.375), End point (0.0, 0.0) Close the loop. Draw the following lines to create the second rectangle, offset from the first by 0.0375 units in the Y direction: - Line 1: Starting point (0.0, 0.375), End point (0.0375, 0.375) - Line 2: Starting point (0.0375, 0.375), End point (0.0375, 0.45) - Line 3: Starting point (0.0375, 0.45), End point (0.0, 0.45) - Line 4: Starting point (0.0, 0.45), End point (0.0, 0.375) Close the loop. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch towards the negative Z direction by 0.3 units to generate the 3D model. The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. **Final shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a vertical rectangular protrusion on one side.** The final shape is the result of combining Part 1 and Part 2. Part 1 is joined with Part 2 using the Join boolean operation. This results in the vertical rectangular protrusion on one side of the rectangular prism. The dimensions of the final shape are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.55 units in height.</description>
